title: 114_s1790
content: The "Safe and Affordable Prescription Drugs Act of 2015" allows for the importation of prescription drugs by individuals. The "Safe and Affordable Prescription Drugs Act of 2015" permits individuals to import prescription drugs into the US under specific regulations within 180 days of enactment. The drugs must be purchased from an approved pharmacy, dispensed by a licensed pharmacist, for personal use in quantities not exceeding a 90-day supply, and with a valid prescription. The imported prescription drugs must have the same active ingredients, route of administration, dosage form, and strength as an approved drug by the Secretary under chapter V. Exclusions include controlled substances, biological products, infused or intravenously injected drugs, and drugs inhaled during surgery. The approved pharmacy in this section refers to pharmacies that handle drugs such as those inhaled during surgery, parenteral drugs, biotechnology-manufactured drugs, refrigerated drugs, and photoreactive drugs. The section defines an approved pharmacy as one located in a specified country, certified by the Secretary to dispense prescription drugs, and meeting certain criteria. The Secretary is required to publish a list of approved pharmacies on the FDA website for purchasing prescription drugs. To be an approved pharmacy, the Secretary certifies that it has been in existence for at least 5 years, operates according to pharmacy standards in its country, and complies with all laws and regulations regarding premises and data reporting. The approved pharmacy must comply with laws and regulations, implement quality assurance programs, use approved laboratories for product testing, and have a process for resolving grievances. The approved pharmacy must comply with laws, regulations, quality assurance programs, approved laboratories for testing, and grievance resolution. Pharmacies will be held accountable for violations of guidelines, not reselling products from online pharmacies outside the country to US customers, and meeting criteria set by the Secretary.
